title: Shrivardhan Beach
subtitle: A Peaceful Coastal Getaway with Historical Charm
overview: Shrivardhan Beach is one of the most beautiful and historically significant beaches along the Konkan coastline of Maharashtra. Located in Raigad district, this tranquil beach is famous for its golden sands, gentle waves, and rich heritage associated with the Peshwa rulers of the Maratha Empire.

The beach stretches for about 3 km and is perfect for swimming, beach walks, and watching the mesmerizing sunset. Shrivardhan also serves as a base for visiting nearby beaches like Diveagar and Harihareshwar.
With its calm ambiance, heritage homes, and friendly locals, Shrivardhan is an ideal weekend escape for families, couples, and history lovers alike.

highlights.title: Golden Sandy Shoreline
highlights.description: The 3 km long beach offers pristine sands and calm waters, perfect for relaxation and long walks.

highlights.title: Historical Significance
highlights.description: Shrivardhan is the birthplace of Peshwa Balaji Vishwanath, one of the earliest Peshwas of the Maratha Empire.

highlights.title: Less Crowded Destination
highlights.description: Unlike Alibaug, Shrivardhan remains peaceful and less commercialized, retaining its coastal charm.

geography.intro: Shrivardhan lies on the Konkan coast of Maharashtra, about 185 km from Mumbai and 160 km from Pune. The region is characterized by rolling hills, coconut groves, and a serene shoreline.

details.label: Landscape
details.value: Flat sandy beach with coconut plantations

climate.description: The beach enjoys a coastal tropical climate with moderate humidity, pleasant winters, and warm summers.

geography.conclusion: Shrivardhan’s consistent tropical weather and scenic landscape make it ideal for year-round beach tourism.

activities.title: Swimming & Sunbathing
activities.description: The calm waves make it safe for swimming and relaxing under the sun.

activities.title: Boating & Water Sports
activities.description: Enjoy small boat rides or thrilling banana boat rides along the coast.
info: Jet ski and kayaking options nearby

activities.title: Photography & Birdwatching
activities.description: Capture panoramic views and migratory coastal birds during winter.

attractions.title: Peshwa Memorial Temple
attractions.description: Built in memory of Peshwa Balaji Vishwanath, this simple yet historic temple highlights Shrivardhan’s Maratha heritage.

attractions.title: Harihareshwar Beach
attractions.description: Known as ‘Dakshin Kashi’, this beach is just 20 km away and home to the Harihareshwar Temple complex.

attractions.title: Diveagar Beach
attractions.description: A scenic beach just 12 km away, known for the Suvarna Ganesh Temple and turtle sightings.

marineLife.intro: Shrivardhan Beach supports a modest yet healthy marine environment typical of the Konkan coast.

items.title: Fish Species
items.description: Fishermen catch pomfret, mackerel, and prawns in nearby waters.

items.title: Clean Marine Ecosystem
items.description: The shallow sea supports diverse aquatic plants and crabs.

conclusion: Marine life is protected by local fishermen communities through sustainable fishing.
Avoid littering to help maintain Shrivardhan’s clean marine ecology.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Shrivardhan is 185 km from Mumbai and 160 km from Pune.
Routes via Mangaon and Mhasla are most preferred by travelers.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest station: Mangaon (65 km) on the Konkan Railway.
Taxis and buses connect Mangaon to Shrivardhan.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airports: Pune (170 km) and Mumbai (200 km).
Cabs and buses available from both airports.

bookingTips.description: Opt for homestays or small beachside resorts for a local experience.
Carry cash as digital payments and ATMs may be limited.
Visit early morning or sunset for best beach views and photography.
